Posts.Content: J2thD wrote: 2 Years since I have been here.  Last time I was scared out of my wits over a screening mammogram that showed "density", thankfully found out it was nothing but dense tissue.  Had my yearly screening and was called by the radiologist 2 days later that they found something that needs to be looked at closer, so I figured "yeah it's dense breast tissue", but apparently not.  It was the other breast and they said it's round and right behind the nipple, 1 cm and it could be a lymph node or a duct.  The "round" part got my attention.  So back for a diagnositc and U/S on Thursday.  Sound familiar to anyone? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Back again.... J2thD susan13

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 11:07AM J2thD wrote: Just had the U/S, 2cm round solid mass right behind the nipple.  Radiologist says they probably won't need to biopsy since it had showed on past mammos and doesn't appear to be growing.  The decision is up to the gyn.  Interesting since this is the first I've heard of this mass and one has to wonder why I was never told if it had been there for a few years.  Personally, I would like the thing out and biopsied before it invites it's friends over.  Do I sound insane?
Posts.Title: Back again.... J2thD susan13
